tasks.subtask: Review the CLI output to confirm successful project creation and initial configuration (AC1.1.1).
Verify the presence of key configuration files: `tailwind.config.ts`, `postcss.config.js`, `eslint.config.js`, `tsconfig.json`, `next.config.js`.
Select "New York" as the style when prompted.
Verify the `components.json` file is created and correctly configured (AC1.1.2).
Confirm the `ui/` directory within `components/` is created (AC1.1.3).
Manually inspect the generated project directory for the presence of `app/`, `components/`, `lib/`, and `hooks/` directories (AC1.1.3).
Check the `tsconfig.json` for the `@/` path alias.
Briefly review a few generated files (e.g., `app/layout.tsx`, `app/page.tsx`) to ensure adherence to kebab-case for files and PascalCase for components (AC1.1.4).
Verify that the ESLint configuration is active and capable of identifying potential naming convention violations.
Execute the build command: `npm run build`.
Confirm the build completes without errors (AC1.1.5).
(Optional) Start the development server (`npm run dev`) and perform a basic browser check to confirm the application loads.

acceptanceCriteria.criterion: The project is created with Next.js 15, TypeScript 5, Tailwind CSS 4, and ESLint 9.
shadcn/ui is initialized and configured with the New York style.
The folder structure matches the Architecture document (`app/`, `components/`, `lib/`, `hooks/`).
Naming conventions (kebab-case for files, PascalCase for components) are established.
The project builds successfully with `npm run build`.

doc.title: Product Requirements Document
doc.snippet: The application will be a Single-Page Application (SPA) to provide a fluid user experience. It will be optimized for modern browsers including Chrome, Firefox, and Edge.

doc.title: Architecture
doc.snippet: First implementation story should execute: `npx create-next-app@latest crosslist --typescript --tailwind --eslint`

doc.title: Architecture
doc.snippet: This section contains the summary of technology stack decisions, including Framework, Language, Styling, UI Components, and Linting.

doc.title: Architecture
doc.snippet: This section defines the initial folder structure for the project, including `app/`, `components/`, `lib/`, and `hooks/`.

doc.title: UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: The chosen design system for Crosslist is shadcn/ui. This decision is driven by its strong alignment with the project's technical stack (React, Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS) and its philosophy of providing customizable, accessible components.

doc.title: Epics and User Stories
doc.snippet: Establish the technical foundation (Next.js app, Supabase, Chrome Extension shell) to enable all future feature development.

constraints.constraint: Naming Conventions: kebab-case.ts for files, PascalCase for components, camelCase for functions, snake_case for database.
Error Handling: Agent errors reported to UI via XState onError, API routes return standard format.
Logging Strategy: Console logging with prefixes in dev, Sentry in prod.
Execute `npx create-next-app@latest crosslist --typescript --tailwind --eslint` for project initialization.
Execute `npx shadcn@latest init` and select "New York" style for UI components.
Confirm `tsconfig.json` includes the `@/` path alias for absolute imports.

tests.standards: Use Vitest for fast unit/logic testing. Use Playwright for critical browser automation and extension E2E testing.
tests.locations: Unit tests co-located with the source files (`*.test.ts`). E2E tests in a dedicated `e2e/` directory.
